name: European Contact Group
legal: No legal status - Informal grouping of the six largest accounting networks in the European Union
goal: The ECGâ€™s primary objectives, acting in the public interest, are to help build public confidence in the profession and in the ECG members; to participate in constructively shaping the regulatory environment, work pro-actively with EU and national policymakers to identify opportunities to remove existing regulatory barriers within the EU that impede the development of a free market in accounting and auditing services; to provide constructive input to standards-setting in the EU; and take a leadership role in promoting the development and consistent application of high-quality international standards (e.g. transparency, ethics, independence, auditing, public sector, education and financial reporting) so as to stimulate and accelerate national and European adoption of these standards.
interests: Competition, Economy, finance and the euro, Institutional affairs, Single market, Taxation
euInitiatives:
Audit, Accounting, Corporate Governance and Tax. In recent years the interest representational activities of the ECG have largely focused on aspects of the Statutory Audit Directive (Directive 2006/46/EC). The ECG's principal concern was to ensure that the adopted Directive would help enhance the quality of audits and financial reporting for the benefit of the capital markets both within the EU and around the world. Following the
adoption of an Amended Statutory Audit Directive in April 2014 together with a separate Regulation on the statutory audits of Public Interest Entities, the ECG will monitor the effective implementation to assess whether it is working in the public interest and will pursue a range of other initiatives that support the reputation of the 6 member networks of ECG and the public interest.
